oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A multirate adaptive estimation algorithm developed earlier (Gudi et al., 1995) is extended to perform estimation of nutrient levels using frequent on-line measurements of the carbon dioxide evolution rate (CER) and off-line, infrequent and delayed measurements of the biomass and substrate concentrations. It has been shown that the algorithm can be designed to track changing substrate yield coefficients as well. The estimation algorithm has been verified using simulations and industrial data from a fed-batch fermentation involving a Streptomyces specie. It has been coupled with a nonlinear control law designed to track prespecified optimal nutrient trajectories. The resulting closed loop control scheme is evaluated using simulation runs.
